title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Budget supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. In control years, the Mayor submits the budget to the President for transmission to Congress, following specific budget procedures. Unauthorized obligations and expenditures are prohibited. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Budget supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. In control years, the Mayor submits the budget to the President for transmission to Congress, following specific budget procedures. Unauthorized obligations and expenditures are prohibited unless approved by the Council or Congress during a control year. After the annual budget is adopted, reprogramming of amounts requires approval from the Mayor and Council, with any additional expenditures offset by reductions in other activities. Unauthorized obligations and expenditures are prohibited unless approved by Congress during a control year. The term 'control year' is defined in the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. The term 'control year' is defined in the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. Congressional review period for budget acts is amended to take effect after a 30-calendar-day period. The Congressional review period for budget acts under section 446 takes effect after a 30-calendar-day period, unless a joint resolution disapproving the Act is enacted within that time frame. If the 30-day period ends when neither House is in session, the period is extended for 5 additional days. The Congressional review period for budget acts under section 446 allows for a joint resolution to disapprove the Act within a specified time frame. If passed by both Houses of Congress and transmitted to the President, the resolution repeals the Act. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act to reflect these changes. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act to reflect changes related to the Congressional review period for budget acts under section 446. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act to reflect changes related to the Congressional review period for budget acts under section 446, including amendments to sections 202(d)(3)(A), 11206, and the table of contents of the Act. SEC. 3. Action by Council of District of Columbia on line-item vetoes by Mayor of provisions of budget acts. Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to change the wording regarding transmission of items to the President. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to clarify terminology within the subsection. The Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended to define the term 'control year' in a new paragraph. SEC. 4 amends Section 447 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to allow employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council. SEC. 5 includes other conforming amendments related to changes in the federal role in the budget process. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to give federal authority over the budget-making process during control years. Restrictions are placed on approving budgets that are not consistent with the financial plan. The term "control year" is defined in the Act. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to give federal authority over the budget-making process during control years, with restrictions on approving budgets not consistent with the financial plan. The term "control year" is defined in the Act. SEC. 6. CONTINUATION OF GENERAL PROVISIONS IN APPROPRIATIONS ACTS. Any general provision in a general appropriation bill regarding Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the enactment of a new bill for the following fiscal year. SEC. 7. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments apply to District of Columbia budgets starting from October 1, 2004.
